nodes.bodyText:
This format seems a bit uncommon for user-agent. Usually, it has the format <product>/<version> (e.g. zeebe-client-java/0.24.0).
What do you think about changing it?

I'd happily change it but this is the format used in the C# and node clients so I figured it was better to stick to one format. Do you think it's better to break from that and change it here and in the Go clients?

You're right. I also prefer one format for all clients. But I would also prefer a more common format.
Let's shortly ask the maintainers @Zelldon and @jwulf what they are thinking of changing the user-agent format?
I fine with that. In the end it doesn't matter. It is just to find out which client is used at the cloud.
Please create then issues in the corresponding clients.

We should add a comment on why this is needed.
I suggest to put it as the first item before the plugins. Otherwise, it is easy to oversee.
The logger package looks a bit uncommon with .util. Maybe, we can have a logger for general or managing things io.zeebe.client.
